description.narrative:
Ujima Foundation provides opportunities to marginalized youth in Kenya by offering them quality vocational education and linking them with the labour market.
Problem: skills learned in TVET institutes did not match the demands from the hospitality industry. Competencies such as communication, conflict management, time management and ownerships is not sufficiently developed with employees which results in a gap in staff competency.
Long term objective: to provide marginalized youth the tools they need for self-support by offering them quality, relevant vocational training.
Ujima becomes self-sustaining through its income generating activities
480 youth trained in hospitality skills Link 480 youth to labour market Improve quality of training by enhancing quality of internships, improving track and trace, Improve sustainability of Ujima by seeking certification

participating-org.narrative: Ujima Foundation for Training and Development - UFTD

receiver-org.narrative: Ujima Foundation for Training and Development - UFTD
Ujima Foundation for Training and Development - UFTD

title.narrative: Education providers supported and capacitated to establish relationships with relevant key stakeholders and to apply 7-steps to WORK

description.narrative: Education providers supported and capacitated to establish relationships with relevant key stakeholders and to apply 7-steps to WORK

Education providers are supported in conducting a labour market analysis, identify most market relevant vocations and link with potential employers for internships or job placements. Support could consist of 7-steps to WORK training provided to TVET trainers.

title.narrative: Young people have decent income through (self) employment

description.narrative: Young people have decent income through (self) employment

title.narrative: Number of young people with decent income through (self) employment

description.narrative: Edukans wants marginalised youth to get (self) employed in order to finally develop a sustainable livelihood. This is achieved through (technical) vocational training and Life skills training. The training helps youngsters to be professional in obtaining and keeping a job or start their own business

title.narrative: % of youth that completed vocational education

description.narrative: The percentage of youth that completed vocational education out of all youth that received vocational education in an Edukans project. This indicator is an indication for the quality of education. In addition, drop-out could be estimated using the completion rates.

title.narrative: Youth stating to be (self)employed 6 months after completing training

description.narrative: Youth stating to be (self)employed 6 months after completing training

title.narrative: Number of youth stating to be (self)employed 6 months after completing training

comment.narrative: used total number of narrative report not indicator report

title.narrative: Youth trained in market relevant skills

description.narrative: Youth trained in market relevant skills
This indicator refers to the scope of Edukans' reach in the technical/vocational education field. All TVETs that are directly involved in projects of Edukans are measured by this number.
